text:
i;m not sure if you can help with this or weather it is actually a bug in 
Apache HTTPD but i;m running MOD_SSL for Apache 1.3.29, PHP 4.3.5 and Apache 
1.3.29 and about 1 in every 3 pages that i submit the data in the forms are 
lost.
This can be data either sent on the URL line (eg a GET) or data in a form (eg 
POST) and sometimes even cookies.
I had the problem with PHP 4.3.4 so I upgraded to 4.3.5 to see if that was the 
problem and that did not make a difference.
I was just wondering if this is something unique or whether there was anyone 
else who had reported this?

Many thanks
Adam French
Systems Manager
QueByte Solutions
creator: afrench@quebyte.com

text:
Look in your apache logs to make sure apache is actually seeing the variables
in the query string on these requests.  Also, check to make sure the data
gets to a simple CGI script.  If it does, the chances are very high
that this is a php problem.

And no, I haven't seen any other reports like this.

Thanks for using Apache!
creator: slive@apache.org
